subject: Photography
title: Presets, Filters, and Automation
description: A quick, practical guide to Presets, Filters, and Automation.

hook.text: One click: moody and cinematic. Another click: bright and airy. Presets turned editing into fast food.

buildup.text: Presets are saved editing recipes that apply a set of adjustments instantly to any photo.

discovery.text: Instagram's early success was built on filters â€” simplified presets that made any phone photo look stylized.

twist.text: Over-reliance on presets creates homogeneous-looking photography. Millions of images start to look identical.

climax.text: Presets are starting points, not endpoints. The best photographers customize them to serve each individual image.

punchline.text: A preset is a suggestion. The edit is yours.

quiz.question: What is the risk of over-relying on editing presets?
options: Photos start to look homogeneous and lose individual character
